name: Sour Cream Chicken Paprika
author: DEME
summary: My father would make this when I was a child. When I make it now, it reminds me of home. It is a milk, rich and creamy recipe. My family's all time favorite! A one-skillet dish. Serve over hot cooked egg noodles or rice, if desired.
ingredients: 4  breast half, bone and skin removed (blank)s skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
directions: You can leave breasts whole or cut them up, whatever your preference
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat
Add chicken and pan-fry until cooked through and juices run clear, about 10 minutes
Remove chicken from skillet and set aside
Using the same skillet, cook onion in butter until translucent but not brown, about 5 to 8 minutes
Pour chicken stock into the pan, and bring all to a boil
Reduce heat to simmer; mix flour with sour cream until smooth, then whisk into chicken stock
Place chicken in skillet; simmer until chicken is heated through and sauce has thickened
